titleStmt.title: Real Friend Harran
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.

spanGrp.span: The father says to his son, “Where were you, my son? You were late today till the sunset. Where did you stay?” The son replies, “Actually, my father, I was with my friends.”
The next day, the same thing happens. “My son, where were you today?” The son replies, “Actually, my father, I was with my friends.” “Where were you today?” – “Again, with my friend.”
He said, “My son, stay at home! Look, I am here. What good do your friends do for you? These friends of yours are all of no use.
I am telling you that they are of no use; they are not true, real friends.” The son asked, “How, father?”
He said, “My son, today …” This is a sheep. I pretend to want to kill a man. “I killed a man in the house, here he is.”
He covered the sheep which he had hslaughtered. He had covered it with a white cloth and did not show it to his son.
He said to him, “Go to your friends and the let’s see. Tell them, ‘My father killed a man. What should we do?’ What plan do they have?”
So, he went to his friend, to his friends whom he usually visits. He came to Ali and said, “Ali! My father has killed a man, what should we do?”

He said, “Hey, buzz off! Your dad should go away! He can kill as many men as he wants. Do you think I am responsible for your father? No, brother! I am not like that. Go!” In other words, he dismissed him.
He went to another one saying, “Musa! My father has killed a man, come! You are my friend, come and help me! A friend should give you advice, provide a plan!”
He replied, “Why don’t you leave from here? This is none of my business. Your father killed a man, and you want me to come and involve myself in this? Do you think I’m crazy?”
In short, all his friends made an excuse to not help him, meaning they did not fulfill his request.
He came and said, “My son, what have you done? They kicked you out, didn’t they?” That’s what his father said to him.
He knew before he came and said to him, “Didn’t they kick you out?” The son replied, “Yes, indeed, father, they did kick me out.”
He said, “What should I do, my father?” He replied, “My son, go to my friend Muhammad Ali!
He is my real friend; he is my companion. My companion Muhammad Ali is at such and such place.”
He asked, “How should I go?” The father replied, “Say, ‘Muhammad Ali, my father has killed a man and sends you his greetings, asking what he should do. Give him advice.’”
He went to him, (but before) and said, “Where is the man?” He replied, “Say that my father has killed a man in our house. And tell him that I need his help to assist me.”
He went to his house and said, “Peace be upon you!” He replied, “And upon you peace!" He then said, “Uncle, I am the son of so-and-so and my father has sent me to you.
He says that he has killed a man and I should go to my uncle so he can see and come up with a plan to help us.”
He said, “Alright, son of my brother! I will go and you should also go now. I want to go to the police station, to the gendarms.”

He went to the police station and said, “At so-and-so’s house, at my friend’s house: I was there and had a fight with someone. As for the man there, I am the one who killed him and I have come to surrender myself to you.”
He surrendered himself to the police before going to his father (the boy’s father).
At the police station, the officers apprehended him and said to him, “Go! Where is the one you killed?” He replied, “At my friend’s house. Come, let’s go there!”
When they arrived at the house, the man was found with his hands bound in chains, and the police were with him, the gendarms.
He said to his son, “Look, my son! Look, this is my friend! Without even listening to my explanation,

he went and surrendered himself, saying, ‘I am the one who killed the man.’ This is my friend, not just a companion. A friend is different, and a companion is different. A friend carries more weight.”
The police asked, “Hey, where is the one you killed?” He replied, “Sir, I did this for my son.
I didn’t kill anyone.” He lifted the cover and there it was: a sheep which he had slaughtered. He said, “I did this for my son as I was teaching him a lesson to make him more aware.
This story was fabricated for him, but in reality, I didn’t kill anyone. I said, ‘Go, bring me your companions. Where are they?’
And all I see is my real friend who came directly to you and said, ‘I am the one who killed him.’” The story I know is narrated this way. Enjoy it!
